question: 1. The concept of nakshatras (lunar mansions) was developed (i) The sky was divided into 27 (later 28) nakshatras (ii) each associated with specific stars or constellations

The statements about Surya Siddhanta are: (i) one of the foundational texts of Indian astronomy, (ii) provides detailed mathematical models for the motion of celestial bodies (iii) describes various astronomical instruments.
Read following statements about Aryabhata's Contributions: (i) Heliocentric Model... (ii) Accurate Calculations... (iii) Aryabhatiya...
For the Residential Areas in Ancient India
options: The inner city should house the royal family and administrative offices and the outer areas should be reserved for merchants, artisans, and commoners.
The inner city should house the merchants, artisans, commoners and the outer areas should be reserved for royal family.
The inner city and the outer areas had no discrimination.
The inner city should house the merchants, artisans, and commoners and the outer areas should be reserved for administrative offices.
answer: The inner city should house the royal family and administrative offices and the outer areas should be reserved for merchants, artisans, and commoners.
